page.title: 02Outdoor Pursuits,Llandogo.1.
page.content: The Priory, an Outdoor Pursuits Centre, is in Llandogo which is near the River Wye. The Priory is a large old house, where parties of school children come and stay for a week and see the local area. It was built in 1840, by Lady Gough, and it came into Holiday Fellowship in 1930. The Priory belongs to the H.F. Holidays organisation. The Priory is managed by a husband and wife team. The Priory has 4.1 acres of land.It is made up of three buildings. The main house has six large rooms and four small rooms.The annexe can accommodate twenty-one people, and the cottage, sixteen people.The priory can take a maximum of ninety-five people altogether. There is a staff of five people to help look after the children and to keep the place tidy.
